p: The stigma of being seen at health services is another major barrier to utilising services. Human rights baseline studies conducted by the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria found breaches in professional ethics by healthcare workers, and a lack of confidentiality and gossiping is common. This was a particular concern for key populations who fear that healthcare workers would disclose their personal information, including their sexual orientation or their HIV status, outside of the clinic setting which would then be known throughout the community. Some providers tend not to refuse treatment but instead make it extremely difficult and more expensive forcing people living with HIV to seek treatment elsewhere [ 40].
